Name: Muscat
Description: The capital city of Oman, known for its modern architecture, cultural landmarks, and scenic coastal views.

Name: Dhofar
Description: A southern region known for its lush greenery, mountainous terrain, and the monsoon season.

Name: Al Batinah North
Description: A coastal region known for its fertile plains, agriculture, and proximity to the capital.

Name: Al Batinah South
Description: A southern part of the Al Batinah region, with similar agricultural prominence and a mix of coastal and inland geography.

Name: Al Dakhiliyah
Description: An inland region famous for its historical sites, traditional markets, and mountainous landscapes.

Name: Al Sharqiyah North
Description: A region located along the eastern coastline, known for its fishing industry, beaches, and natural reserves.

Name: Al Sharqiyah South
Description: The southern counterpart to Al Sharqiyah North, with a mix of agriculture, tourism, and coastal culture.

Name: Musandam
Description: A geographically isolated region located on the northernmost tip of Oman, known for its stunning fjords and mountainous landscape.
